channel.title: Reverse engineering slides
channel.description:
Hi A while ago I did a presentation on reverse engineering for a group at a local uni. I thought the slides and binaries I used could be useful, so I'm posting it here. I'd like to point out that many of the binaries I used are not mine, many came from skidophrenia which was hosted on ctfd.io by @_py. The other crackmes which I didn't write were from [NoREPls](https://0x00sec.org/t/crackme-norepls-part-1/2974) by @dtm. I'd also like to thank @Leeky along with some people I know irl (C_Sto, kronicd and curryhacker) for checking over the slides for me.
I uploaded it [here](https://github.com/lkw657/reversing_slides)

item.title: Reverse engineering slides
item.dc:creator: lkw
item.description:
I have some links to more information on the last slide. The main thing I would recommend is this free book. Also, do challenges, I’d start with the ones provided under crackmes.
